Posts.Content: good news. I bet you are relieved.
Posts.Title: update! on Repeat mammogram & ultrasound

Posts.Content: My cousin had surgery yesterday to remove a lump that was cancer. Her only clue was a small lump. Get checked out.
Posts.Title: What Were Your Symptoms?

Posts.Content: Joe, I was put to sleep under anthesthia so I felt nothing. The surgeon made an incision around the nipple and removed the ducts to be biopsied. I had surgical tape as stitches. It wasn't painful except to have clothing touch me as I was ultra sensitive. I turned black, blue and green for a couple of weeks but it was ok. Actually, I have to say it was kind of nice to just stay in sweats and do a jigsaw puzzle instead of household chores. I saw the dr the other day. He said the breast is still hard around the nipple area. I told him I didn't realized how much it hurt until after the surgery was done and the pain was gone. He said there was probably some infection in there prior and the ducts were pulling the nipple in. My breast looks different but believe me I don't care! Hope that answered your questions.
Posts.Title: stereotactic now excisional biopsy question please 1 2

Posts.Content: Joe, I went to a general surgeon to my biopsy surgery. He took out my breast ducts and had them biopsied. I picked hm as he was the surgeon who removed my husband's spleen. I called and asked if he did biopsies. Mine wasn't just a needle it was a surgery. Good luck. I didn't have cancer but when I went today to see him I said it was nice to be out of pain. I siad I didn't realize I was hurting that much prior to the surgery. He said I probably had an infection prior.
Posts.Title: stereotactic now excisional biopsy question please 1 2

Posts.Content: I have had techs look at the film and say she needed to take more pictures. If I were a tech, I would want to make sure I had a clear picture or a more detailed picture before the radiologist looked at it. In my case, this last time they came back in and said they wanted to do an ultrasound.
Posts.Title: HELP - mammogram tech scared me!

Posts.Content: I have dense tissue and routinely have the ultrasound done at the same time as the mammogram.
Posts.Title: Dense Breast Tissue?

Posts.Content: Hi I had an inverted nipple, no discharge, itchy. I went to my obgyn (new to me because I have kaiser insurance now) He told me sometimes when you get older and heavier this can happen. I am 57. My mammogram and ultrasound was normal, but the radiologist recommended a consult with a surgeon. My mom and great aunt had cancer. An inverted nipple can mean inflammatory breast cancer. I had a surgical breast biopsy, some lymph nodes were removed. I was fine. Surgeon said I had some infection in there. Anyway all is good. Just had another check up and have a different obygn.
Posts.Title: Inverted nipple, leakage, pain, - ultrasound

Posts.Content: Do you have your report from last year? Did you have anything that might want to be looked at again this year to see if there are any changes? They look at mine every year to compare cysts or tissue changes. Last year the radiologist came in to talk to me. That was new....but everything was fine.
Posts.Title: HELP - mammogram tech scared me!

Posts.Content: A few months ago my right breast nipple inverted and it is like a slit. It isn't always like that. No redness, dimpling kind of sore, but could be mentally induced now since I am concerned. I went to the obgyn and he ordered an ultrasound which I am having Monday. I am concerned about inflammatory breast cancer. He didn't feel any lumps, but I know there often are no lumps with this cancer. He said though getting older and heavier can do this. That is a new one to me but then again, how often does this come up in a conversation with girl friend's?
Posts.Title: inverted nipple

Posts.Content: My mammo didn't show anything but because of my mom's history of breast cancer and the fact that I can't have a MRI, I am being sent to a general surgeon. I am picking up the reports and the cd of the tests and will probably be able to see the dr next week. I spoke to his wife who handles the front office and I get the impression a punch biopsy will be done. It was suggested by a volunteer at a breast organization that I also get checked for Paget's as that can cause an inverted nipple. So far everyone has laughed that my HMO obgyn said it may be due to gaining weight and getting older. I could find that easier to accept if it were affecting both breasts. Will keep you "abreast" of the situation.
Posts.Title: inverted nipple

Posts.Content: Sounds like a good tech though. In the past I had a mammogram and then while there waiting, the tech looked at it and then went to the radiologist and came back in and said they were going to do an ultrasound. Ok that freaked me out. Turned out I do have severe fibrocystic breast disease and each year they compare the patterns and the cysts. I get nervous because my mom had breast cancer. However, because she has her yearly mammograms they caught it stage one, so pat yourself on the back for having your annual. I am going to start a new thread on my situation
Posts.Title: HELP - mammogram tech scared me!

Posts.Content: Maria, I just got home from the ultrasound. The tech did the scan and then said she was getting the dr and he would want to check himself. Gulp. I was scared but then told myself I want answers and maybe this is why I am so fatigued and sweaty. Anyway, dr took one look and made the comment that the nipple is definitely inverted and it is not normal to go from a regular looking nipple to inverted. However, he could not find anything. He said he wants me to have a mammogram because if there is something there it still may be too small to be picked up in an ultrasound. He said it definitely needs to be watched. He would have sent me over for the mammogram tomorrow but since I have kaiser I have to play the game their way and might have to go to one of their mobile units. Egad. I won't feel comfortable with their findings or lack of findings no matter what. I haven't heard of a nipple inversion being hereditary. But since you want to find out if mom or sis have it, just take a deep breath, tell them you are uncomfortable discussing it but you need a yes or a no. It's weird I could talk over anything and everything with my girlfriends but for some reason I cringed discussing things with my mom and sister too.
Posts.Title: inverted nipple

Posts.Content: thanks for the chuckle Maria. I see the surgeon Wednesday. I am still trying to figure out why we can't use the word mammogram. Boobogram ok?
Posts.Title: inverted nipple

Posts.Content: I can't have MRIs because I have metal in my face but I have had the contrast injected for cat scans. Usually they do a quick kidney function blood test just before the test. If you have severe asthma they may give you an antihistimine. Otherwise, it is a warm rush that lasts for a second and then that is it. Drink lots of water afterwards to flush it out of your system. Very very rare to have a reaction
Posts.Title: doctor insisting on mri for breast

Posts.Content: Maria, I too was surprised as I always have a mammo and then an ultrasound is ordered so I thought they show up more stuff. The dr said the xray may pick it when as it may be too small for the ultrasound. I feel comfortable with his decision as my girlfriend's husband is a dr in another state and when she shared with him what was going on with me, he said I needed a mammogram. I really trust his expertise. No matter what at least the dr said it is something we will be watching as this isn't normal so I would hope I won't go longer that a few months at a time. Now the waiting is for the insurance to approve it. That can take awhile unless the dr made some calls himself. Good luck in talking to your mom and sister
Posts.Title: inverted nipple

Posts.Content: kitty, kitty that is a good question. Why is the word not allowed? Is the word ct scan allowed?
Posts.Title: inverted nipple

Posts.Content: I had a surgical biopsy done last October because of an inverted nipple. I am glad I had it done. The surgeon took a couple ducts and had them biopsied and the ducts were pulling the nipple in which can be a symptom of Inflammatory breast cancer. It was a surgery. I was put out. I came home a few hours later. It was a good excuse to have guilty pleasure in doing a jigsaw puzzle over the next couple of days. I had some soreness, a stitch or two, but it was such a relief to know I was ok. Now I am scheduled to have a follow-up mammogram and ultrasound.
Posts.Title: What would you do? Surgical biopsy or 6 month follow-up???

Posts.Content: hi I had a surgical biopsy because my nipple inverted. It was an hour surgery. I had tape and a few bandaid stitches over the breast. Some ducts were removed. The worse pain was just having my top material touch the nipple as it was very sensitive. I didn't have cancer. I have a follow-up mammogram coming up within a few weeks of the surgery 6 months ago. good luck
Posts.Title: Excisional/surgical biopsies - Any advice?

Posts.Content: Do you have any itching or redness? Warmth? There is IBC (inflammotory breast cancer) a rare type of breast cancer not usually seen on a mammogram. I had a friend whose mom had it, many years ago or I would have never heard of it. However, just a few months ago it was discussed on the news.
Posts.Title: retracted nipple 1 2

Posts.Content: I have an appointment next week because my nipple is doing the same thing. It has a slit too. Definitely not normal. The concern I would have is Inflammatory Breast Cancer or IBC. It isn't real common and I don't think alot of doctors are real savy on it. I would get a second opinion. I too have fibrocystic breast disease. I always have an ultrasound in addition to a mammogram. It is so important to stay on top of these things. My mom had a calcium deposit in her breast. In one year it went to cancer. Thankfully, stage one so she caught it early thanks to annual screening. lilsunshine, I would go to another dr asap. breast pain sucks? Oh pleeeeeze. good luck
Posts.Title: retracted nipple 1 2

Posts.Content: Wow, I don't think you can sue Kaiser either. I think you can take it to arbritration. I assume you wrote on the medical paperwork prior to the mammogram that you had implants? I didn't realized they have machines for natural vs implants. When I had implants they would carefully just pull the implant from the chest wall and take a lot of extra pictures. When I had them removed, UCLA wanted me to donate my unruptured implant so they could test it to see how much pressure it could take before rupturing. That told me alot. For all I know, the mammograms I had could have ruptured the one as it took 5 years to find out why I was so sick. What I don't understand is Kaiser will pay for the removal of both, when it would be easier for them to just replace the one implant. Then again, what makes sense doesn't mean much sometimes. Do you have any documentation or the package insert from the company who made the implant? If not contact them and ask them what their recommendations are as far as mammograms and if the rules weren't followed try presenting that to the review board. Good luck.
Posts.Title: mammogram injury

Posts.Content: Maria, I don't have any of the burning, itching, redness etc either. I did have reconstruction surgery after I had breast implants removed years ago, but it was my other breast that I had the rupture and had to have the tissue removed. I had all the itching, redness, heaviness, burning etc and yet doctors told me there was nothing wrong with my implants. It wasn't until the media broke with the news about implants that I found a doctor from UCLA who suspected I had a rupture and sent me to the chief of staff who did the surgery and reconstruction. If the doctor next week tells me no big deal, I am one who may not believe him. I haven't felt well for some time. No weight loss though.
Posts.Title: retracted nipple 1 2
